text.eng: Are you ill, or caring for someone who is ill?
text.amh: Are you ill, or caring for someone who is ill?
text.orm: Are you ill, or caring for someone who is ill?
text.tig: Are you ill, or caring for someone who is ill?

text.eng: Are you answering for yourself or someone else?
text.amh: Are you answering for yourself or someone else?
text.orm: Are you answering for yourself or someone else?
text.tig: Are you answering for yourself or someone else?

text.eng:
Are they experiencing any of the following life threatening symptoms?
  • Not experiencing any life threatening symptoms
  • Extremely fast or shallow breathing
  • Blue colored lips or face
  • Not waking up or not interacting when awake
  • So irritable that the child does not want to be held
  • Seizures
text.amh:
Are they experiencing any of the following life threatening symptoms?
  • Not experiencing any life threatening symptoms
  • Extremely fast or shallow breathing
  • Blue colored lips or face
  • Not waking up or not interacting when awake
  • So irritable that the child does not want to be held
  • Seizures

text.eng:
Are you (they) experiencing any of the following life threatening symptoms?
  • Not experiencing any life threatening symptoms
  • Blue colored lips or face
  • Severe and constant pain or pressure in the chest
  • Severe and constant dizziness or lightheadedness
  • Acting confused (new or worsening)
  • Unconscious or very difficult to wake up
  • Slurred speech (new or worsening)
  • New seizure or seizures that won won’t stop
text.amh:
Are you (they) experiencing any of the following life threatening symptoms?

  • Slurred speech (new or worsening)
  • New seizure or seizures that won won’t stop

text.eng:
Do you (they) have any of the following?
  • Coughing up blood (more than about 1 teaspoon)
  • Signs of low blood pressure (too weak to stand, light headed, feeling cold, pale, clammy skin)
  • Ribs are pulling in with each breath (retractions)
  • Dehydration

text.eng:
In the two weeks before you (they) felt sick, did you (they):
  • Have contact with someone diagnosed with COVID 19
  • Live in or visit a place where COVID 19 is spreading
text.amh:
In the two weeks before you (they) felt sick, did you (they):
  • Have contact with someone diagnosed with COVID 19
  • Live in or visit a place where COVID 19 is spreading

text.eng: Do you (they) have any of the following? (Check any)
text.amh: Do you (they) have any of the following? (Check any)
text.orm: Do you (they) have any of the following? (Check any)
text.tig: Do you (they) have any of the following? (Check any)

text.eng: Do you (they) live in a long-term care facility or nursing home?
text.amh: Do you (they) live in a long-term care facility or nursing home?
text.orm: Do you (they) live in a long-term care facility or nursing home?
text.tig: Do you (they) live in a long-term care facility or nursing home?

text.eng: In the last two weeks have you (they) worked or volunteered in a hospital, emergency room, clinic, medical office, long-term care facility or nursing home, ambulance service, first responder services, or any healthcare setting, or taken care of patients as a student or part of your work?
text.amh: In the last two weeks have you (they) worked or volunteered in a hospital, emergency room, clinic, medical office, long-term care facility or nursing home, ambulance service, first responder services, or any healthcare setting, or taken care of patients as a student or part of your work?

text.eng:
How is your (their) breathing? Which of these are you (they) experiencing?
  • Severe gasping for air or cannot talk without catching your breath
  • Mild: you can get enough air in your lungs but your chest feels tight when you take a deep breath
text.amh:
How is your (their) breathing? Which of these are you (they) experiencing?

  • Mild: you can get enough air in your lungs but your chest feels tight when you take a deep breath

text.eng: This Coronavirus Self Checker is for people who are at least 2 years old.
text.amh: This Coronavirus Self Checker is for people who are at least 2 years old.
text.orm: This Coronavirus Self Checker is for people who are at least 2 years old.
text.tig: This Coronavirus Self Checker is for people who are at least 2 years old.

text.eng: Urgent medical attention may be needed. Please call 911 or go to the Emergency Department.
text.amh: Urgent medical attention may be needed. Please call 911 or go to the Emergency Department.
text.orm: Urgent medical attention may be needed. Please call 911 or go to the Emergency Department.
text.tig: Urgent medical attention may be needed. Please call 911 or go to the Emergency Department.

text.eng:
Sorry you you’re feeling ill. You have some symptoms that may be related to COVID 19. You also have
medical conditions that may increase your risk of some infections or complications from COVID 19. Call
your healthcare provider, clinician advice line, or telemedicine provider within 24 hours. Start home
isolation. This means stay home except to get medical care, and do not go to work, school, or public
areas. Do not use public transportation or ride sharing. Be sure to get care if you feel worse.
Read important information about caring for yourself or someone else who is sick and follow these steps
to help protect others from getting sick .

text.eng: Please contact the occupational health provider (or supervisor) in your healthcare facility as soon as possible and let them know you you’re feeling ill.
text.amh: Please contact the occupational health provider (or supervisor) in your healthcare facility as soon as possible and let them know you you’re feeling ill.
text.orm: Please contact the occupational health provider (or supervisor) in your healthcare facility as soon as possible and let them know you you’re feeling ill.
text.tig: Please contact the occupational health provider (or supervisor) in your healthcare facility as soon as possible and let them know you you’re feeling ill.

text.eng: Living in a long term care facility or nursing home may put you at a higher risk for severe illness. Tell a caregiver at the facility that you are sick and need to see a medical provider as soon as possible.
text.amh: Living in a long term care facility or nursing home may put you at a higher risk for severe illness. Tell a caregiver at the facility that you are sick and need to see a medical provider as soon as possible.
text.orm: Living in a long term care facility or nursing home may put you at a higher risk for severe illness. Tell a caregiver at the facility that you are sick and need to see a medical provider as soon as possible.
text.tig: Living in a long term care facility or nursing home may put you at a higher risk for severe illness. Tell a caregiver at the facility that you are sick and need to see a medical provider as soon as possible.

text.eng:
Sorry you you’re feeling ill. You have one or more symptom(s) that may be related to COVID 19. Stay home and take care of yourself. This means stay home except to get medical care, and do not go to work, school, or public areas. Do not use public transportation or ride sharing. Be sure to get care if you feel worse or you think it is an emergency.

Read important information about caring for yourself or someone else who is sick and follow these steps to help protect others from getting sick.
